description: Borrowed from French stéthoscope, a word coined by its inventor, physician René Laennec, equivalent to stetho- +‎ -scope.

entries.meaning: (medicine) A medical instrument used for listening to sounds produced within the body.

verbs.description: stethoscope (third-person singular simple present stethoscopes, present participle stethoscoping, simple past and past participle stethoscoped)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To auscultate, or examine, with a stethoscope.
examples: you wish me to submit to be stethoscoped; if so, you shall be gratified, although the prospect of undergoing that, or any other operation at Mr. Pigwidgeon's hands, is not the most agreeable
